abstract_summ: Based on the results, we propose a venue-access-based contact tracing solution, VenueTrace, which preserves user privacy while enabling proximity contact tracing.A new system concept, called PrivyTRAC, preserves user privacy, increases security and improves accuracy of smartphone contact tracing.While the global deployment of contact tracing apps aims to protect the health of citizens, these apps have raised security and privacy concerns.We further mitigate the 24-hour data exposure of infected individuals and reduce computational time for identifying if a user has been exposed using k-Anonymity buckets of hashes and Private Set Intersection.Some countries have already decided or are planning to base their contact tracing apps on GAP.
title_summ: Quest: Practical and Oblivious Mitigation Strategies for COVID-19 using WiFi DatasetsPrivyTRAC: Privacy and Security Preserving Contact Tracing SystemDigital Contact Tracing Service: An improved decentralized design for privacy and effectivenesszkSNARKs to the rescue: proof-of-contact in zero knowledgeVetting Security and Privacy of Global COVID-19 Contact Tracing ApplicationsDecentralized Privacy-Preserving Proximity TracingConfidential Computing for Privacy-Preserving Contact TracingBeeTrace: A Unified Platform for Secure Contact Tracing that Breaks Data SilosPrivacy Preservation in Epidemic Data CollectionCross HashingFully Distributed, Privacy Respecting Approach for Back-tracking of Potentially Infectious ContactsApps Gone Rogue: Maintaining Personal Privacy in an EpidemicPACT: Privacy Sensitive Protocols and Mechanisms for Mobile Contact TracingAssessing Disease Exposure Risk with Location Data: A Proposal for Cryptographic Preservation of PrivacyA Privacy-Preserving Solution for Proximity Tracing Avoiding Identifier ExchangingTraceSecure: Towards Privacy Preserving Contact Tracing: Security&Privacy Risks of Contact Tracing AppsTracking and Controlling the Spread of a Virus in a Privacy-Preserving WayPrivacy-Preserving Contact Tracing: current solutions and open questionsAnonymous Collocation Discovery: Harnessing Privacy to Tame the CoronavirusCoVista: A Unified View on Privacy Sensitive Mobile Contact Tracing EffortPriLok: Citizen-protecting distributed epidemic tracingPANDA: Policy-aware Location Privacy for Epidemic SurveillanceA: Anonymizing encounters in Decentralised Contact Tracing ProtocolsMind the GAP
title_abstract_phrases: While the global deployment of contact tracing apps aims to protect the health of citizens, these apps have raised security and privacy concerns.Some countries have already decided or are planning to base their contact tracing apps on GAP.While the concept of a confidential computing backend proposed in this paper can be combined with any existing contact tracing smartphone application, we describe a full contact tracing system for demonstration purposes.We compare a centralized and decentralized approach on a legal perspective and find a decentralized approach preferable considering proportionality and data minimization.zkSNARKs to the rescue: proof-of-contact in zero knowledgeThis paper describes techniques to help with COVID-19 automated contact tracing, and with the restoration efforts.Hence, a number of public health authorities have experimented with automated contact tracing apps.
